required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open Trial of Telehealth Group for Improving Peer Relationships (PEERS) in NF1
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of a Telehealth Group for Improving Peer Relationships for Adolescents With Neurofibromatosis Type 1

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open trial of the UCLA PEERS protocol delivered via Telehealth with teens with neurofibromatosis type 1 whose parents report that they have difficulty making and keeping friends.

primary_outcome.measure: Social Skills Improvement System - SEL (SSIS-SEL; Gresham & Elliot, 2017)
primary_outcome.time_frame: within four weeks of PEERS completion
primary_outcome.description: Parental report of social skills (SSIS-SEL Total Score; Mean 100, SD 15; Higher scores mean stronger social functioning

primary_outcome.measure: Test of Adolescent Social SKills (TASSK: Laugeson & Frankel, 2010)
primary_outcome.time_frame: within four weeks of PEERS completion
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire completed by teen participants; measures knowledge of the PEERS intervention concepts (raw total score; higher score means stronger functioning)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within four weeks of PEERS completion
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire completed by caregivers on social function and autism symptoms (SRS Total Score; Mean 50, SD 10; higher scores mean greater difficulties

arm_group.description: Participation in 16 week telehealth administration of the PEERS protocol for teens (parallel teen and parent/caregiver groups)

intervention.description: 16 week telehealth intervention; parallel teen and parent/caregiver groups; 90 minutes each week.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Physician diagnosis of neurofibromatosis type 1
- Age 12-17
- Main language spoken in the home is English
- Reliable internet access
- Current functional impairment in peer relationships
- Teen is interested and motivated to participate
Exclusion Criteria:
- Main language spoken in the home is not English
- Cognitive or developmental delays that affect reading comprehension or understanding of treatment material
- Significant behavioral concerns
- Other comorbid medical conditions
- Major surgery in past 6 months
- Prior social skills group treatment within past 6 months
- Prior participation in PEERS

patient_data.ipd_description: Deidentified data will be available upon request to qualitied investigators.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Available following publication of the research findings
